meanings.definition: Having the opposite of the desired effect
meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy before a test is counterproductive.
meanings.sent2: Staying up late can be counterproductive when trying to wake up early.
meanings.sent3: Trying to run faster by wearing heavy shoes would be counterproductive.
meanings.sent4: His constant interruptions were counterproductive to the team's progress.
meanings.sent5: Using a broken compass is as counterproductive as having no compass at all.

meanings.definition: Tending to hinder rather than help
meanings.sent1: Constant complaining can be counterproductive in a team setting.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring safety guidelines is counterproductive to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent3: Wearing sunglasses at night might seem counterproductive but can be stylish.
meanings.sent4: The heavy traffic was counterproductive to reaching the destination on time.
meanings.sent5: Using a blunt knife is more counterproductive than helpful in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Working against one's goals or objectives
meanings.sent1: Procrastination is often counterproductive to achieving good grades.
meanings.sent2: Skipping meals can be counterproductive to maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: Wearing mismatched socks might be counterproductive to a polished look.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude was counterproductive to building strong relationships.
meanings.sent5: Trying to fix a leaky roof with a bucket is clearly counterproductive.
